questions.questionText: A car travels 120 km in 2 hours. Find its speed.
A train 100m long passes a pole in 10 seconds. Find its speed in km/hr.
Two trains of length 100m and 150m running at 40 km/hr and 50 km/hr in opposite directions. Time to cross each other?
questions.explanation: Relative speed = 40+50 = 90 km/hr = 25 m/s. Total length = 250m. Time = 250/25 = 10 seconds

questions.questionText: A person walks at 5 km/hr and reaches 15 minutes late. At 6 km/hr he reaches 10 minutes early. Find the distance.
questions.explanation: Time difference = 25 minutes = 5/12 hours. Distance = (5×6)/(6-5) × 5/12 = 6.25 km

questions.questionText: A person covers half distance at 40 km/hr and remaining half at 60 km/hr. Find average speed.
A train 150m long crosses a platform 250m long in 20 seconds. Find its speed.
Two cars start from same point in opposite directions at 50 km/hr and 60 km/hr. After how much time will they be 330 km apart?
A man walks at 4 km/hr and rows at 8 km/hr. If he covers 20 km partly by walking and partly by rowing in 3.5 hours, find distance walked.
questions.explanation: Let walk distance = x. (x/4) + ((20-x)/8) = 3.5. Solving: x = 8 km

questions.questionText: A train running at 54 km/hr crosses a pole in 12 seconds. Find length of train.
A person travels for 2 hours at 40 km/hr and 3 hours at 50 km/hr. Find average speed.
questions.explanation: Total distance = 80+150 = 230 km. Total time = 5 hours. Average = 230/5 = 46 km/hr
